blog.name: fitness-journey-of-a-fat-girl
blog.title: Everyday Is A New Day
blog.description: I’m a 23 year old college student who has struggled with weight my whole life. Recently my mother was diagnosed with diabetes and I had my own “pre-diabetic” scare. I was also diagnosed with PCOS and some mental illness. I’ve been eating the recommended diabetic carb intake since 9/12/18. I have also been a vegetarian for seven years now and I’m allergic to gluten. I have a long way to go and wanted to keep a blog of my journey! Even if I’m the only one reading this I want to be able to look back on my progress. However, I hope you come along for the ride and get something out of this! :)

summary: So... I’m dumb and thought that using the carpet in my living room would be good enough instead of a yoga mat. Now I have...
body:
So… I’m dumb and thought that using the carpet in my living room would be good enough instead of a yoga mat. Now I have bruises on both of my knees!

Also, I’ve only been doing yoga for two days.. so like an hour total. I used to think it was kinda silly and easy but wow was I wrong. My whole body woke up aching today. I’m so sore. However, I also feel so stretched and ready to go again!

I will be digging up the old yoga mat that I know is hidden somewhere in the basement first though!

description:
On Saturday, college football fans have four bowl games to help them get into the holiday spirit. The action kicks off at noon ET in Birmingham and also will feature games in Texas and Hawaii before the night is over. These also will be the last bowl games played until the day after Christmas so be sure to get your college football fix in!

summary: I’m A Celebrity’s James McVey says jungle forced him to confront eating disorder: "I had a problem"
title: I’m A Celebrity’s James McVey says jungle forced him to confront eating disorder: "I had a problem"
body:
Musician James McVey has opened up about his battles with an eating disorder, admitting his time on ITV’s I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here! forced him to tackle his “negative relationship” with food.

The 24-year-old said: “The jungle diet pushed my body and mind to the absolute limit. I felt like I was wasting away.

“The contrast between my body before and after has taught me a lot. It’s made me recognise that years ago I had a problem.”

The Vamps guitarist explained he first noticed he had a problem five years ago, saying his disorder “dictated my life”.

“I didn’t want to go out for meals because I didn’t want to eat food I couldn’t control,” he said in an interview with The Mirror.

  • Read more

Emily Atack suffered panic attack just before entering I’m a celeb

"I didn’t realise how much that had taken over my life and it still does play a big part now. It’s a constant battle to try to recognise that moderation is a good thing.”

Speaking about his eating disorder before entering the jungle, where campmates generally live on daily rations of beans and rice, McVey told The Mirror he is now focussed on improving his relationship with food.

He said: “I’m happy that now I’ve come full circle and see food as a positive.

“I don’t want to belittle other people who have anorexia, but I think I definitely had a negative relationship with food in those early days. I was obsessed with food.

“It’s now about building muscle and getting leaner. You need to eat more of the good things.”

Anorexia (or anorexia nervosa) is a serious mental illness where people are of low weight due to limiting their energy intake, according to the UK’s leading charity supporting those affected by eating disorders, Beat.

The charity believes approximately 1.25 million people in the UK have an eating disorder.

The National Institute of Health and Clinical Excellence estimates around 11 per cent of those affected by an eating disorder are male.

Beat’s Head of Communications Rebecca Field told the Independent: “It takes a lot of courage to speak out about an eating disorder but doing so will help to combat the stigma and misunderstanding around the illnesses, especially for men and boys.

"We hope that James has received the support he needed and that his bravery will encourage others to seek help.”

Ms Field added it is important to realise you do not have to be underweight to have an eating disorder.

“These illnesses affect people of all ages, genders and backgrounds, and the physical symptoms such as weight loss or gain are only signs of the underlying mental health issues,” she said.

View this post on Instagram

Back with the princess

A post shared by James McVey (@jamesmcvey) on Dec 19, 2018 at 2:16pm PST

McVey came fifth place on the show. English football manager Harry Redknapp went onto be crowned this year’s winner.

If you have been affected by any issues mentioned in this article, you can contact Beat on 0808 801 0677 and find out more information here.

blog.name: jitendrachaturvedi
blog.title: Newskart.com
blog.description: Online Technology, Trending News and Startups

summary: When should you seek an appointment at a Singapore cardiologist heart specialist clinic?
title: When should you seek an appointment at a Singapore cardiologist heart specialist clinic?
body:
New Post has been published on http://www.newskart.com/when-should-you-seek-an-appointment-at-a-singapore-cardiologist-heart-specialist-clinic/

When should you seek an appointment at a Singapore cardiologist heart specialist clinic?

Health is wealth! Every person craves a healthy body that helps them carry on their daily tasks. The human heart is one organ that most people are careful about. No one wants a heart failure suddenly which can cost their lives. But the key to a healthy heart depends not just on no smoking and other food habits, but also a balanced state of mind. Sometimes, excess stress and tension can result in heart irregularities as well.

Sometimes excess gas and GERD symptoms often mimic heart problem symptoms! It is here that you need to understand the symptoms correctly. It could be that you are on a vacation or a work tour in Singapore and you develop some health irregularities and you don’t know whether you should opt-in for a Singapore heart specialist clinic or not. Discussed below are some of the health symptoms for which you should consult an expert heart specialist.

  1. Sudden sweating in an uncontrollable way – If you notice that you’ve started sweating uncontrollably, chances are it’s to do with your heart. However, first, try and calm down a bit and see if the situation gets any better. Sometimes, a nervous or panic attack could also feel the same. But if you sense that your health is undergoing some inner turmoil that you can neither control nor understand, then it’s always better to consult a heart specialist and get the best medical perspective and advice.
  2. Sudden bouts of short-breath followed by extreme fatigue –It natural to feel fatigued and a little bit short-breath at times, especially if you have been under extreme stress and feel physically drained. However, if you suddenly feel that your breathing is becoming difficult and you are way more fatigued that calls for attention, it’s a smart call to consult a heart specialist.
  3. Sudden pain on your left side – There are times when you can get gas pains up your chest. But if you feel a numbing and squeezing pain on your chest, bending towards the left side, you should consult a doctor or a heart specialist on an emergency basis. If not, things might aggravate.
  4. Nausea with pain –There are times when there are mild attacks or heart problems that go unnoticed! So suddenly if you feel nauseous with the spreading from the center of your chest to your shoulders, neck, jaws, and hands, it is important that you consider checking with a heart specialist. The reason could be entirely different after a medical check-up, but it is important to seek medical guidance.
  1. Sudden fainting –If there’s someone who has fainted suddenly and is recording a low pulse, you need to rush the person to a medical expert or at a heart specialist clinic to get a proper medical diagnosis done and also start the treatment.

The sign of a heart issue is not always loud and visible! Sometimes, it comes combined with other bodily discomforts. Hence, whenever you find someone witnessing the symptoms mentioned above or any other severe bodily issues, it is always better to check with a heart specialist.

Also read: How Mediclaim Differs from A Health Insurance Policy? and Best 20 Life Insurance Companies in India

trail.content_raw:
New Post has been published on http://www.newskart.com/when-should-you-seek-an-appointment-at-a-singapore-cardiologist-heart-specialist-clinic/

When should you seek an appointment at a Singapore cardiologist heart specialist clinic?

Health is wealth! Every person craves a healthy body that helps them carry on their daily tasks. The human heart is one organ that most people are careful about. No one wants a heart failure suddenly which can cost their lives. But the key to a healthy heart depends not just on no smoking and other food habits, but also a balanced state of mind. Sometimes, excess stress and tension can result in heart irregularities as well.

Sometimes excess gas and GERD symptoms often mimic heart problem symptoms! It is here that you need to understand the symptoms correctly. It could be that you are on a vacation or a work tour in Singapore and you develop some health irregularities and you don’t know whether you should opt-in for a Singapore heart specialist clinic or not. Discussed below are some of the health symptoms for which you should consult an expert heart specialist.

  1. Sudden sweating in an uncontrollable way – If you notice that you’ve started sweating uncontrollably, chances are it’s to do with your heart. However, first, try and calm down a bit and see if the situation gets any better. Sometimes, a nervous or panic attack could also feel the same. But if you sense that your health is undergoing some inner turmoil that you can neither control nor understand, then it’s always better to consult a heart specialist and get the best medical perspective and advice.
  2. Sudden bouts of short-breath followed by extreme fatigue –It natural to feel fatigued and a little bit short-breath at times, especially if you have been under extreme stress and feel physically drained. However, if you suddenly feel that your breathing is becoming difficult and you are way more fatigued that calls for attention, it’s a smart call to consult a heart specialist.
  3. Sudden pain on your left side – There are times when you can get gas pains up your chest. But if you feel a numbing and squeezing pain on your chest, bending towards the left side, you should consult a doctor or a heart specialist on an emergency basis. If not, things might aggravate.
  4. Nausea with pain –There are times when there are mild attacks or heart problems that go unnoticed! So suddenly if you feel nauseous with the spreading from the center of your chest to your shoulders, neck, jaws, and hands, it is important that you consider checking with a heart specialist. The reason could be entirely different after a medical check-up, but it is important to seek medical guidance.
  1. Sudden fainting –If there’s someone who has fainted suddenly and is recording a low pulse, you need to rush the person to a medical expert or at a heart specialist clinic to get a proper medical diagnosis done and also start the treatment.

The sign of a heart issue is not always loud and visible! Sometimes, it comes combined with other bodily discomforts. Hence, whenever you find someone witnessing the symptoms mentioned above or any other severe bodily issues, it is always better to check with a heart specialist.

Also read: How Mediclaim Differs from A Health Insurance Policy? and Best 20 Life Insurance Companies in India

title: Gluten Free Italian Crouton Casserole
body:
Gluten Free Italian Crouton Casserole #sponsored

With baked goods and traditional dishes, the holidays can be tough when you are on a gluten free diet. Thanks to my partnership with Little Northern Bakehouse, I’m finding more ways to “Eat for Me” by making my favorite Italian Crouton Casserole recipe gluten free!

This time of year, I love to make non-traditional foods that still have a vibrant festive flair. Gluten Free Italian Crouton…
